After the function was over, college students proceeded towards Mission Vengthlang and Lawipu to obstruct the Hon'ble Union Minister of State for Railways from attending the felicitation function of Khuangchera at Khuangchera Hall, Ailawng.

 

 19.8.2016       Today, i.e. 19.8.2016 @ 9:00 AM, the Central Young Lai Association (CYLA) performed  picketing duty against  Pu R. Lalsangluaia, Addl. DC, Lawngtlai District and Pu Lallawmawma, SDO (S), Lawngtlai  and CYLA activists obstructed the two MCS officers from attending offices. The two officials were earlier asked by CYLA to abstain themselves from attending offices. Meanwhile, it was reported that the two officials availed leaves but activists of CYLA performed duties to prevent movement of files at the residences of the two officials. Activists of CYLA dispersed peacefully at around 1:30 PM and no untoward incident was reported. About 100 (one hundred) activists, comprising of OBs of YLA Town Branches staged the picketing today. It was learnt that Pu R. Lalsangluaia, Addl. DC had already left Lawngtlai yesterday, i.e. 18.8.2016 and Pu Lallawmawma, SDO (S) is also scheduled to leave Lawngtlai tonight.

 

25.8.2016         Today, i.e. 25.8.2016 @ 10:00 AM, 6 (six) Office Bearers of Aizawl Taxi Workers Union (ATWU) led by their President, Pu Raphael Lalrinmawia, organised a Sit-in demonstration near Department of Transport Office, Chaltlang in protest against the Government’s Notification on rotational plying of taxis, limited time frame for replacement of commercial vehicles, etc. The Sit-in demonstration was called off @ 3:45 PM peacefully and no untoward incident was reported during the Sit-in demonstration. It was learnt that ATWU is scheduled to hold Sit-in demonstration again on 1st September, 2016 near Chief Minister's Office gate.

 

26.8.2016         Today, i.e. 26.8.2016 @ 10:00 AM, about 200 (two hundred) activists of Hortoki village under the aegis of All Vehicles Association, Hortoki commenced an indefinite blockade of movement of vehicles at three locations along the road of Hortoki and Kawnpui. It was learnt that the blockade will be continued until positive response is received from the Government.

 

28.8.2016         Pu H. Lalengmawia, Deputy Commissioner, Kolasib District convened a joint meeting with JAC Coordination Committee, Hortoki and the three Contractors, viz. Postal Company, N.C. Das Company and Narada Company under Railways at Hortoki on 28.8.2016 @ 6:00 PM with regard to the blockade of road between Hortoki and Kawnpui by villagers of Hortoki. JAC Coordination Committee, Hortoki agreed to call off their blockade after the said three contractors gave assuarance that they will immediately commence repairing of the road. The DC also assured leaders of Hortoki village that he will pursue their demand to the Government. However, it was learnt that leaders of Hortoki village are determined to continue their blockade if the repairing of road is not up to their satisfaction.

 

1.9.2016           OBs and Executive Members (numbering 15 persons) of Aizawl Taxi Workers’ Union (ATWU) organised a Sit-in demonstration today, i.e. 1.9.2016 from 10:00 AM near Chief Minister's Office gate, McDonald Hill, Aizawl in protest against the Government's Notification on rotational plying of taxis, replacement of old vehicles, etc. The Sit-in demonstration was called off indefinitely at 3:30 PM without any untoward incident.

 

14.9.2016         Mizo Students' Union (MSU) Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte torched the transfer order of Pu F. Lalromawia, Lecturer, Department of History, Government Kamalanagar Higher Sec. School, Chawngte today, i.e. 14.9.2016 @ 10:00 AM at Government Kamalanagar Higher Sec. School. Pu F. Lalromawia, has been reportedly transferred to Government Kamalanagar Higher Sec. School, Chawngte from Government J.L. Higher Sec. School, Aizawl on 14th September, 2015 but allegedly resisted to comply with the transfer order till date. About 500 (five hundred) students including members of Mizoram Chakma Students' Union (MCSU) participated at the function.

 

15.9.2016         MNF party organised processions/rallies simultaneously in Aizawl and at District Capitals such as Lunglei, Champhai, Serchhip, Kolasib, Mamit, Siaha and Lawngtlai today, i.e. 15.9.2016 in protest against MLPC Act.

                                          In Aizawl, over 800 activists of MNF took out a procession, marching from Chanmari junction upto Vanapa Hall. They chanted slogans and displayed posters and placards condemning Congress Ministry over the vending of liquors and demanded revocation of MLPC Act. During the procession, Pu Tawnluia, Sr. Vice President;
Pu Lalruatkima, MLA; Pu Zoramthanga, President and Dr. R. Lalthangliana, Vice President delivered speeches at Chanmari, Zarkawt, Israel Point and infront of Vanapa Hall respectively.

                                          In Lunglei, about 170 (one hundred seventy) members of MNF participated at the procession. In Champhai, vehicle rally was organised in which around 300 (three hundred) activists paraded with around 100 (one hundred) vehicles. In Kolasib, about 150 (one hundred fifty) activists took out procession from Khuangpuilam to Diakkawn. About 200 (two hundred) members of MNF took out procession in Serchhip from AOC Veng upto Bazar Veng. Vehicle rally was organised in Mamit by around 300 (three hundred) activists using about 100 (one hundred) vehicles. In Lawngtlai, gathering in protest against MLPC Act was also organised at Aeropagi, Lawngtlai Bazar in which over 50 (fifty) members participated. In Siaha, MNF District Headquarters displayed posters in protest against MLPC Act today.

 

22.9.2016         Today, i.e. 22.9.2016 @ 10:30 AM, residents of Zohnuai Veng, Lunglei, numbering around 200 (two hundred) gathered infront of CJM office, Lunglei and demanded to see Stephen Lalchawiliana (26), S/o H. Remlalliana of Lawngtlai, the accused for the murder of C. Lalsawmliana (33), S/o C. Lalrinawma, Zohnuai, Lunglei on 27.8.2016 vide Lunglei PS Case No.186/16, Dt.27.8.2016 u/s 302 IPC. The residents of Zohnuai were reportedly irritated over the Hearing of the Case by CJM  yesterday, i.e. 21.9.2016, prior to the predetermined date for hearing, i.e. today. The angry crowd pelted stones at the office of CJM and they reportedly destroyed window glasses and windowpanes of CJM office. They also forcibly tried to enter into the office of the CJM. However, Police have guarded the gate of the office and prevented the mob from entering the office. It was further reported that some sections of the mob have entered and ransacked the official quarters of Pu R. Malsawmdawngzuala, CJM, Lunglei located at AP Tlang, Lunglei and the quarters of one staff of CJM, Lunglei. They destroyed most of the furnitures, windows, TV, refrigerator, utensils, etc. and burnt the mattressess of Pu R. Malsawmdawngzuala. Leaders of Sub-Headquarters YMA, Lunglei also rushed immediately to CJM Office to pacify the angry crowds and acted as mediator. However, the effort of leaders of Sub-Headquarters YMA, Lunglei to control the situation had failed. The Executive Magistrate, Lunglei then declared impostion of Section 129 of CrPC for the dispersal of the unlawful assembly @ 4:15 PM. Acting upon the imposition of Section 129 of CrPC, the Police have arrested 17 (seventeen) members of the unlawful assembly and were kept into police custody. Criminal cases are being registered at Lunglei PS and the situation is under control for the time being.

 

23.9.2016         1) The residents of Venglai, Lunglei numbering about 30 (thirty) organised a Sit-in demonstration at Tennis Court, Lunglei today, i.e. 23.9.2016 @ 12:00 noon under the aegis of VC, Venglai in protest against the proposed construction of Police Station at the Tennis Court premises. Posters and Placards were displayed. The Sit-in demonstration was peacefully called off at 5:37 PM.

 

                           2) Mizo Students' Union (MSU) Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte continued their picketing of students of Govt. Kamalanagar Hr. Secondary School from 21.9.2016 in protest against  non-compliance of the transfer order by Pu F. Lalromawia, Lecturer, who has reportedly been transferred to Govt. Kamalanagar Hr. Sec. School from Govt. JL Higher Sec. School, Aizawl on 14.9.2015. The meeting of MSU, Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte held today resolved to organise picketing against teachers of Govt. Kamalanagar Hr. Sec. School during 26th to 28th September, 2016 and intended to organise Total Bandh if positive response is not received from the Government.

 

                           3) Today, i.e. 23.9.2016 at wee hour i.e. 2:00 AM, Vanlalpianga (37) s/o Piangkhama, P/A Hmunhmeltha, Myanmar presently resided at Chhuarlung village had confessed that he had murdered of Elizabeth (32) d/o J. Malo and N. Siadei (70) w/o B. Laichia (L) of Chhuarlung village on 7.9.2016 vide Siaha PS C/No 91/16 dated 8.9.2016 u/s 302 IPC. The accused Vanlalpianga was accordingly evacuated to District Jail, Lunglei today i.e. 23.9.2016 @ 10:00 AM from Siaha under proper escort. Consequence upon his confession, members of MTP (Mara Thyutlai Py) and MCHP (Mara Chano Py) assembled in front of Siaha Police Station at 11:00 AM, demanding to see the face of the accused. The situation was escalated with the arrival of about 100 (one hundred) agitating villagers of Chhuarlung at the Police Station. The angry crowd stormed into the Police Station at around 5:30 PM and vandalised the Police Station buildings and the furnitures. They demanded a documentary proof of the evacuation of the accused, Vanlalpianga from Siaha Police Station to District Jail, Lunglei. Addl. DC Siaha and other officials are trying to control the situation while writing this report.

 

27.9.2016         Mizoram Chakma Students' Union (MCSU) General Headquarters, Chawngte and Central Young Chakma Association (CYCA) took out a procession today, i.e. 27.9.2016 @ 11:00 AM from Bhuddist Mandir, Chawngte to CADC Office, Chawngte. Pu Jagadish Chakma, President, MCSU and Pu Jyotirmoy Chakma, President, CYCA delivered speeches near CADC Office and about 800 (eight hundred) activists had participated and the rally went off peacefully at 12:30 PM.

 

28.9.2016         Mizo Students' Union (MSU) Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte called off their picketing against students and teachers of Govt. Kamalanagar Hr. Secondary School from today, i.e. 28.9.2016. It was reported that leaders of MSU Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte intended to meet Hon'ble Governor with regard to their demand for posting of History Lecturer at Govt. Kamalanagar Hr. Sec. School, Chawngte.

 

13.10.2016       Joint Action Committee of Young Chakma Association (YCA) and Mizoram Chakma Students' Union organized Sit-in Demonstration infront of the office of Chakma Autonomous District Council (CADC), Chawngte in protest against non-implementation of MoU signed between CADC and NGOs on termination of all the staff/employees appointed illegally in CADC from January, 2015. The agitators also burnt an effigy of Pu Kali Kumar Tongchongya, CEM, CADC today at 1:30 p.m.

 

14.10.2016       Chawngte Area Joint Action Committee continued their blockade of all roads leading to Chawngte from Lunglei and Lawngtlai today, i.e. 14.10.2016 @ 6:00 a.m.

 

17.10.2016       1) Joint Action Committee (JAC) Bawngkawn commenced their indefinite Sit-in demonstration from today, i.e. 17.10.2016 @ 9:00 a.m in front of Khiangte Wine Shop, Bawngkawn. The Sit-in demonstration has been organised in protest against the opening of Khiangte Wine Shop by Pi K. Lalramnghaki at Bawngkawn area. About 20 (twenty) activists had turned out today and no untoward incident was reported during the Sit-in demonstration.

 

                           2) About 300 (three hundred) people from Sairang, Sairang Dinthar and Sihhmui took out a procession yesterday, i.e. 16.10.2016 @ 1:00 p.m from Sihhmui towards BSF Camp, Lengpui Airport road in protest against the reported sexual molestation of a juvenile by BSF personnel, Shri. Baljit Singh (49), S/o Ram Gishan on 14.10.2016. They chanted a slogan demanding the dismissal of Shri. Baljit Singh. The procession was called off without untoward incident after the authority of BSF agreed to give compensation to the victim.

 

                           3) Joint Action Committee, Chawngte area had called off their blockade of road from 5:00pm as the constructions of roads between Chawngte-Chhumkhum and Chawngte - Diltlang were reportedly resumed by the contractor and State PWD.

 

21.10.2016       All NGOs of Lungsen (YMA, ZDU, MSU, MZP, MHIP) and Lungsen VC-I & II organised 'Total Bandh' within Lungsen town, Lunglei District today, i.e. 21.10.2016 (from 6:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m) in demand for the repair of dilapidated road between Lungsen and Lunglei. The total bandh was called off at 4:30 p.m today and no untoward incident was reported.

 

24.10.2016       1) Today, i.e. 24.10.2016 @ 9:00 a.m, about 60 (sixty) activists of MNYF General Headquarters led by Pu K. Vanlalvena, President, MNYF gathered at the office premises of Directorate of Land Revenue & Settlement, Aizawl and organised picketing against the staff of Directorate of Land Revenue & Settlement. MNYF asked the staff to abstain themselves from attending office until the Government revoked the rate of Stamp Duty. Pu K. Vanlalvena, President; Pu T.C. Pachhunga, General Secretary, MNF and Pu David R. Lalsawmtluanga, Secretary, Vigilance, MNF delivered speeches. They shouted slogans demanding revocation of the hike of Stamp Duty.

                                          The MNF activists withdrew themselves at around 2:15 p.m following the decision of the meeting of officials of Land Revenue & Settlement Department held under the aegis of Pu R. Romawia, Hon’ble Minister, LR&S held today @ 11:15 a.m to suspend ‘The Indian Stamp (Mizoram Amendment) Act, 2016’.

 

 

 

         2) All NGOs of Lungsen (YMA, ZDU, MSU, MZP, MHIP) and Lungsen VC-I & II organised indefinite blockade of vehicles w.e.f. 22.10.2016 within Lungsen area in protest against dilapidated condition of road.

                                          Pu C. Laldawngliana, SDO (Highway Division) held a meeting with leaders of all NGOs Lungsen today, i.e. 24.10.2016 @ 10:30 a.m at Lungsen Chhim Veng VC House and appealed the NGO leaders to call off their blockade. Subsequently, All NGOs convened a meeting under the chairmanship of Pu Lalropuia, Chairman, Lungsen Vehicles Association and 18 (eighteen) members were present. The meeting agreed to call off their blockade and the blockade of road was finally called off at 3:30 p.m. 

 

1.11.2016         1) Lawngtlai District Commercial Vehicles Joint Action Committee (LDCVJAC) organised indefinite blockade of road between Lawngtlai and Vaseikai (Western Belt of Lawngtlai District) commencing from today, i.e. 1.11.2016 @ 6:00 a.m in demand of repairing of dilapidated road. Leaders of LDCVJAC performed duty and Maxi Cab services from Lawngtlai to Lunglei and Aizawl were also suspended  today.

 

         2) Information has been received that the people of Zawlnuam, under the aegis of Joint Village Council and NGOs staged protest against the closedown of 4th IR Battalion Out-Post (BOP) at Bawrai by obstructing personnel of the BOP from transferring out of the BOP today, i.e. 1.11.2016. Joint VC and NGOs have detailed 15 (fifteen) persons to perform duty today.

                                          However, the protest was called off this afternoon after leaders of VC and NGOs of Zawlnuam were informed by DC Mamit that the proposal for the closing down of BOP at Bawrai has been withdrawn by the Government by issuing an order today. It was learnt that the Sub-Committee on Security, Govt. of Mizoram will deliberate upon the issue of closing down of BOP at Bawrai in their next meeting.

 

7.11.2016         Lawngtlai District Commercial Vehicles Joint Action Committee (LDCVJAC) had called off their blockade of road between Lawngtlai and Vaseikai (Western Belt of Lawngtlai District) on 7.11.2016 @ 4:30 p.m.

 

8.11.2016         Today, i.e. 8.11.2016 @ 11:00 a.m, MZP Headquarters, Lunglei organised a function in front of Medical Superintendent Office, Lunglei in which they burnt the copies of the transfer orders of the three Medical Officers of Civil Hospital, Lunglei viz. Dr. Thaizi, Dr. Lalremruata and Dr. Lalhriatpuia. MZP Lunglei has burnt the copies as an expression of their grievances against the non-fulfilment of their demand, i.e. immediate posting of Medical Officers by the Government. Pu Lalrammuana, Vice President, MZP Headquarters, Lunglei presided over the function in which Pu Benjamin Vanlalfela, MZP Headquarters, Lunglei and
Pu Vanlalvena Ralte Kawlni, President, Joint Students Union, Lunglei delivered  speeches. MZP Headquarters, Lunglei intended to intensify their demand if positive response is not received from the Government before 16.11.2016. About 50 (fifty) MZP activists and leaders of PRISM Southern Hqrs. and Chhimbial Chhantu participated at the function.

 

9.11.2016         Today, i.e. 9.11.2016 @ 10:15 a.m, a fencing programme of Govt. J. Thankima College site at Brigade area, Bawngkawn was organised in which students and staff of Govt. J. Thankima College and others numbering about 400 (four hundred) gathered. At the function leaders of Bawngkawn NGOs; Pu Vanlaltana, Vice President, MZP; Pu P.C. Lalrinhlua, President, MSU and Pu Ramhmangaiha Ralte, Principal, Govt. J. Thankima College delivered speeches. They conducted measurement of the college area along with officials of LR&S and they put fencing on the frontal portion of the college site. They decided to await the Government's response on the report of the measurement of College site conducted by officials of LR&S. The gathering (Bawngkawn Local Council, Bawngkawn Branch YMA, MHIP Bawngkawn Branch, MUP Bawngkawn Branch, MZP General Headquarters, MSU General Headquarters, Aizawl City Colleges Joint Students Union (ACCJSU), Students Union Govt. J. Thankima College, Staff Welfare Association, Govt. J. Thankima College and Alumni Association Govt. J. Thankima College.

 

10.11.2016       MZP Sub-Hqrs. Kolasib and Govt. Kolasib College Students' Union have jointly organised procession today, i.e. 10.11.2016 @ 1:00 p.m within Kolasib town in protest against the recent murder of Lalenkawli, student of Govt. Kolasib College. They chanted slogans and displayed posters condemning the murder of Lalenkawli and demanded the authority to take legal action against the offender. A function was conducted at Diakkawn @ 1:50 p.m in which Pu C. Zothantluanga, F/o Lalenkawli; Lalmawizuala, Vice President, Students' Union, Govt. Kolasib College; Lalsangliana, President, MZP Sub-Hqrs. Kolasib;  Pi Laltluangi, President, MHIP Sub-Hqrs. Kolasib and Pu Liankunga, President, YMA Sub-Hqrs, Kolasib delivered speeches. About 430 (four hundred thirty) people have participated at the Procession.

 

17.11.2016       MZP Headquarters, Lunglei commenced an indefinite blockade of World Bank Road (Lunglei- Aizawl) from today, i.e. 17.11.2016 @ 7:00 a.m. at the outskirt of Pukpui Village to pressurise the Government on their demand for posting of 3 (three) Medical Doctors at Civil Hospital, Lunglei. Pu Lawmawma Tochhawng, President, MNF Sub-Headquarters, Lunglei and Dr. K Pachhunga, Treasurer, MNF Sub-Headquarters, Lunglei; Pu Eric Zomuanpuia, General Secretary, Chhimbial Chhantu, and Pu Lalhruaitluanga, President, PRISM Southern Headquarters visited the 46 (forty six) MZP activists who performed duties today.

 

18.11.2016       Positive Women Network of Mizoram (PWNM) organised a peaceful procession today, i.e. 18.11.2016 @ 1:00 p.m from Chanmari junction to Vanapa Hall, Aizawl. They demanded the Parliament of India to amend Section 14 of HIV Bill, 2014 for ‘Free & Complete Regular Treatment for HIV patients.’ Pi Lalruatfeli, Secretary, PWNM presided over the procession in which about 60 (sixty) activists have participated.

 

8.12.2016         Today, i.e. 8.12.2016 @ 11:00 a.m, about 200 (two hundred) activists of MNYF General Headquarters led by Pu Lalrindika Chhangte, Treasurer, MNYF assembled near Assembly House, Aizawl as a mark of their protest against Congress Ministry. They dispersed peacefully @ 11:30 a.m after passing the following resolutions :-

                           i) Strongly condemned Pu Lal Thanhawla, Hon'ble Chief Minister for his alleged refusal to make further response to Supplementary Question asked by
Pu Lalruatkima in the Assembly Session held on 6.12.2016. The Supplementary Question was related to construction of 'Bailey Bridge at NH-44(A) over Tlawng river’ (along Sihhmui to Lengpui Road).

                           ii) Accused the incumbent Congress Ministry of showing reluctance towards repairing of dilapidated roads across Mizoram during its 8 (eight) years tenure.

                           iii) Accused Pu John Rotluangliana, Hon'ble Minister, FCS&CA, etc. of showing nepotism on selection of suppliers of food grains and also accused him of responsible for the supply of poor quality food grains and scarcity of cooking gas in Mizoram. They demanded Pu John Rotluangliana to resign from his post.

                                          iv) Demanded the Government of Mizoram to stop selling of liquors.

 

13.12.2016       About 15 (fifteen) activists of MNF led by Dr. K. Beichhua, MLA assembled in front of Mizoram State Election Commission Office, Tuikhuahtlang, Aizawl today i.e.13.12.2016 at 11:00 a.m due to the alleged deletion of 34 (thirty four) voters/persons from the electoral roll of Chhaolo-II Village Council Constituency. However, the activists of MNF dispersed peacefully after they learnt that the Notification issued last night, i.e. 12.12.2016 @10:00 p.m by Mizoram State Election Commission had cancelled the By-election of Chhaolo Village Council-II which is scheduled to be held on 15.12.2016.

 

 

 

 

2017

 

9.1.2017            Rawpuichhip Branch YMA, Mamit District organised indefinite blockade of Rawpuichhip bypass road  from today, i.e. 9.1.2017 in protest against the undue delay of resurfacing of roads within Rawpuichhip village by Gayatri Construction Company. In this regard, Rawpuichhip Branch YMA threatened to obstruct the company workers (i.e. Gayatri Construction Company) from constructing NH-44A unless the repairing of roads within Rawpuichhip village is initiated.

 

10.1.2017           Rawpuichhip Branch YMA continued their blockade of Rawpuichhip bypass road today. However, movement of vehicles along NH-44A are not affected as vehicles can still ply along the road passing through Rawpuichhip village.

 

18.1.2017          Today, i.e. 18.1.2017, Indian National Congress (INC) launched its nationwide protest against demonetisation with party workers  gheraoing Reserve Bank of India (RBI) offices at several locations.  In  Aizawl, about 30 (thirty) activists of MPYCC gathered  in front of  RBI office, Dawrpui Veng, Aizawl today @12:30 p.m. They chanted a slogan and displayed placards in protest against the demonetisation policy and demanded the BJP led Central Government to revoke the demonetisation policy. Pu F. Lalngaihawma, Treasurer, MPYCC also delivered a speech during the protest and  they  peacefully  dispersed  at 1:00 p.m.

 

25.1.2017          eaders of Hmeichhe Insuihkhawm Pawl (MHIP) General Headquarters and Zarkawt Branch MHIP numbering about 40 (forty)  assembled in front of Aizawl District Court today, i.e. 25.1.2017 @ 11:00 a.m. in protest against the bail petition submitted by Lalremruata Ralte (49), the main accused person in sensational murder case of his wife, Zohmangaihi, Zarkawt, Aizawl in 2013. However, due to the absence of the Defence Advocate, hearing of the bail petition of Lalremruata Ralte is rescheduled on 8th February, 2017. It was learnt that Local Council, Zarkawt; Zarkawt Branch MHIP; MHIP General Headquarters and relatives of Zohmangaihi (L) are scheduled to submit a petition against the release of Lalremruata Ralte on bail.

 

1.2.2017            Today, i.e. 1.2.2017 @ 3:40 p.m, around 200 (two hundred) residents of Thuampui locality assembled infront of the office of Aizawl Municipal Corporation (AMC) following public announcement made by leaders of YMA, Thuampui Branch. It is reported that leaders of YMA, Thuampui Branch and Dr. H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC had  misunderstanding over the cutting down of trees near the premises of AMC Building, Aizawl and due to which leaders of YMA, Thuampui Branch demanded a word of apology from Dr. H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC. However, no untoward incident is reported while writing this report.

 

2.2.2017            Today, i.e. 2.2.2017, around 100 (hundred) residents of Thuampui locality assembled in front of AMC Office, Aizawl in demand of transfer of Dr. H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC for his alleged provocation of the sentiment of the residents of Thuampui locality over the issue relating to cutting down of tree (planted and nurtured by YMA Thuampui) within the premises of AMC Office, Aizawl.

                                         In this connection, Local Council, YMA, MHIP and MUP of Thuampui Veng, Aizawl issued a Joint Press Statement today, i.e. 2.2.2017  in which they  expressed their serious concern over the cutting  down of one of the trees planted and nurtured by YMA along the roadside near AMC Office by one AMC Staff(Muster Roll) and the subsequent reaction of  Dr H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC to this incident.  They further stated that the  Commissioner, AMC had maligned the image of Thuampui residents through
Social media and his action really hurted the feeling and sentiment of the residents of Thuampui locality. In a Statement, they further vowed to intensify their protest against Dr. H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC till the authority  take action for his  transfer.

 

3.2.2017            Today, i.e. 3.2.2017, around 70 (seventy) residents of Thuampui locality assembled in front of AMC Office, Aizawl in demand of transfer of Dr. H. Lalthangliana, Commissioner, AMC. They peacefully dispersed after they learnt that the Commissioner, AMC would not turn up for attending the office. In this regard, leaders of Thuampui YMA Branch decided to submit a letter to the Hon'ble Home Minister this evening. They are likely to seek the intervention of the Hon'ble Home Minister for immediate transfer of Dr. H. Lalthangliana from AMC Office.

 

13.2.2017          Aizawl City College Joint Students' Union (ACCJSU) took out a procession with a theme, 'Zirlaite Thlavang Hauhna Kawngzawh' (procession to show solidarity for students) today, i.e. 13.2.2017 @ 11:00 a.m in support of the demands made by ex-students of Nalanda Institute of Advanced Studies (NIAS), Kolkata to Government of Mizoram, like reimbursement of all the expenditures incurred by them and to take initiative for continuation of their studies, etc. Members of ACCJSU marched from Chanmari junction and Sikulpuikawn junction and they culminated at Vanapa Hall. About 2500 students from Government Hrangbana College, Government Aizawl North College, Government Aizawl West College, Pachhunga University College, Government Aizawl College, T.Romana College and Women Polytechnic participated at the procession whereas Government Johnson College, Zirtiri Residential Science College, Government J. Thankima College, Mizoram University and Aizawl Law College did not participate.

                                           The following resolutions were passed during the procession :-

                            i) Slammed the Government over sending of Mizo students to an unverified Institution outside the State and urged the Government to take care of them.

                            ii) Insisted the Political Executives of Mizoram to seek an apology to the students of NIAS for making adverse remarks on them.

                            iii) Urged the Government to take measures for facilitating the students to appear their exam and take initiative against issuance of fake certificates to the students.

                                         iv) Demanded the Government to provide compensation to the students of                         NIAS over the pecuniary loss incurred by them at NIAS. They also                                   expressed their commitment to continue their protest if the Government do                    not give compensation to the students immediately.

 

 

14.2.2017          Today, i.e. 14.2.2017 @ 9:00 a.m. leaders of Aizawl City Colleges Joint Students' Union (ACCJSU) numbering about 54 (fifty four) organised Sit-in demonstration near the gate of Chief Minister's Office (CMO),
Mc. Donald Hill, Zarkawt in support of the demand made by ex-students of Nalanda Institute of Advanced Studies (NIAS), Kolkata to Government of Mizoram. At 3:20 p.m. Leaders of ACCJSU namely, Zodinsanga, President; J.F. Lalhmangaiha, Vice President;
V.L. Muansanga, General Secretary; H. Lalrohlupuia, Asst. Gen. Secretary; Lalbiaksiami, Treasurer; Wycliff Lalchhandama, Fin. Secretary; Vanlalhriatpuia Sailo, Vice President, SU Pachhunga University College and Lalnunpuia, General Secretary, SU Pachhunga University College met Pu Lal Thanhawla, Hon'ble Chief Minister of Mizoram in his Office Chamber and Pu R. Lalzirliana, Hon’ble Home Minister was also present. It was learnt that the meeting was held under cordial atmosphere and consequence upon the meeting, ACCJSU cancelled Total Bandh proposed to be organised tomorrow, i.e. 15.2.2017. During the meeting, Pu Lal Thanhawla, Hon’ble Chief Minister and Pu R. Lalzirliana, Hon’ble Home Minister gave assurance to leaders of ACCJSU to fulfil their resolutions/demands. The meeting also reportedly resolved to send a team comprising of Joint Resident Commissioner, Mizoram House, Kolkata and  Pi Esther Lalruatkimi, IRS, prominent citizen; to visit students of NIAS, Kolkata in the presence of authority of NIAS tonight @ 9:30 p.m at the premises of NIAS, Kolkata to resolve the problems faced by them.  However, leaders of ACCJSU intended to intensify their agitation if their demands were not implemented by the Government on or before 24.2.2017.

 

21.2.2017          Today, i.e. 21.2.2017@11:00 AM , around  250 members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers Association(MCSSHTA) assembled in front of the office of the Chief Minister of Mizoram in demand of (i) payment of their pending salaries (ii) Regularisation of their service.  7(seven) leaders of MCSSHTA met Pu Lal Thanhawla, Hon'ble Chief Minister of Mizoram and  submitted a petition requesting him to take measures for regularisation of the service of members of MCSSHTA  whose engagement period  is to be terminated  on 28.2.2017.

 

                                           Leaders of MCSSHTA also met Pu Lalsawta, Hon'ble Minister, Finance, etc and Pu H. Rohluna, Hon'ble Minister, School Education, etc  today. As the leaders of MCSSHTA  were not satisfied with the response/initiative of Government over their demands, they decided to take out a procession within Aizawl City tomorrow, i.e. 22.2.2017@ 9:00 a.m.  They  will march from Chanmari Junction where the procession is likely to be terminated at Sikulpuikawn, Mission Veng. During the procession, leaders of MCSSHTA will deliver speeches at the following junctions :-

                               (i)        Chanmari                   (ii)       Zarkawt          (iii)     Bazar Bungkawn

                               (iv)      Vanapa Hall              (v)       Tennis Court (vi)      Khatla

                             (vii)    Sikulpuikawn.

 

 

22.2.2017          Around 850 members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers' Association (MCSSHTA) took out a procession today, i.e. 22.2.2017 @ 9:00 AM within Aizawl city. They marched from the junction of Chanmari  upto Vanpa Hall, Aizawl  during which leaders of MCSSHTA addressed the procession at different junctions like Chanmari, Zarkawt, etc.  They peacefully dispersed at around 1:20 PM after they passed the following resolutions :-

 

                               (i)  Demanded the Government to follow CSS Central Guideline and issue their service 'Regularisation Order'  before 25.2.2017.

                               (ii) Demanded Pu Lalsawta, Hon'ble Minister, Finance, etc. to fulfil  the promise he had made during 2013 regarding regularisation of their service.

                               (iii) Demanded the Government to immediately release their 10 (ten) months pending salaries.

                           

                                           MCSSHTA also intended to launch ' Sit-in Demonstration'  in front of the Gate of  Chief Minister's  Office w.e.f  23.2.2016@9:00 AM  if Government fails to fulfil their demand  before  midnight.

 

23.2.2017          1) About 400 ( four hundred) members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers' Association (MCSSHTA) organized 'Sit-in Demonstration' in front of the Gate of Chief Minister's Office, Zarkawt, Aizawl today, i.e. 23.2.2017 @ 9:00 a.m. They also submitted a petition to the Hon'ble Chief Minister of Mizoram requesting him to take measures for regularisation of their service as the term of their  contractual engagement is due to expire on 28.2.2017. In a petition, MCSSHTA  also mentioned their intention to continue their Sit-in demonstration in front of  the Gate of Chief Minister's Office till their demand is fulfilled.

 

                            2) Today, i.e. 23.2.2017 from 7:00 a.m to 3:00 p.m, Undivided Zemabawk Joint NGO (YMA,  MHIP, MUP, Students' Union) organised 'Road Blockade' at NH-54 along the stretch of Bawngkawn to Tuirial in demand of immediate repair of the dilapidated condition of NH-54 between Bawngkawn and Tuirial. All the commercial establishments were closed down and private construction works were also suspended during the 'Road Blockade'. As many as 270 (two hundred seventy) volunteers performed duties at various junctions i.e. Falkland, Thuampui and Tuirial. The 'Road Blockade' was called off @2:30 p.m and no untoward incident was reported  during the Road Blockade.

                                           The meeting of Undivided Zemabawk Joint NGO (YMA, MHIP, MUP, and Students' Union) held today, @2:30 p.m at Thuampui YMA hall decided to resume 'Road Blockade' of NH-54 (including internal roads) tomorrow, i.e. 24.2.2017 @ 7:00 a.m as they did not receive positive response from the Government. The meeting was presided over by Er. Lalrimawia, President, Thuampui Branch YMA and about 50 (fifty) members were present.

 

7.3.2017            Consequence upon the decision of the meeting of MZP Headquarters, Mamit held last night, i.e. 6.3.2017 @ 8:00 p.m at Sub-Headquarters YMA Committee Room, Mamit, MZP Headquarters, Mamit commenced indefinite close down of Government Mamit College from today, i.e. 7.3.2017 in protest against the transfer of Pu Lalrinchhana, Assistant Professor, Government Mamit College. MZP activists numbering about 95 (ninety five) performed duty at the gate of Government Mamit College from 8:30 a.m. At the function organised today near the gate of Government Mamit College, Pu Lalropuia, President, MZP Headquarters, Mamit announced that the close down of Government Mamit College will continue if the transfer order is not cancelled. A Press Release issued in this regard today by MZP Headquarters, Mamit also demanded the authority to take initiative for the posting of Pu Zosangliana Zuala, S/o Lt.Col.(Rtd.) Z.S. Zuala, Assistant Professor, Department of English, Government Mamit College (attached to Government J. Thankima College) at Government Mamit College.

 

8.3.2017            MZP Headquarters, Mamit continued indefinite closure of Government Mamit College today, i.e. 8.3.2017 in protest against the transfer of Pu Lalrinchhana, Assistant Professor, Government Mamit College. However, MZP Headquarters, Mamit called off the closedown of Government Mamit College today @ 1:00 p.m after the transfer order of Pu Lalrinchhana was cancelled by the Government. Government Mamit College will resume classes from tomorrow, i.e. 9.3.2017.

 

20.3.2017          All NGOs Chalrang, Champhai District organised a procession today, i.e. 20.3.2017 @ 6:30 a.m within Chalrang village in protest against the murder of Lalruatmawia, S/o Lalbiaksiama (L) by Sanghluna, S/o Rophira (L) on 12.3.2017. During the procession, the agitating members of All NGOs Chalrang ransacked the house of the accused, Sanghluna. They passed a resolution forbidding Sanghluna from entering Chalrang village in future and they demanded the authority to take severe action against the accused. As many as 300 (three hundred) people participated in the procession.

 

22.3.2017          Around 600 members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers’ Association (MCHTA) staged a Sit-in Demonstration last night, i.e. 21.3.2017 @ 8:00 p.m in demand of regularisation of their services/posts. The agitating members decided to continue their protest, i.e. Sit-in Demonstration tonight, i.e. 22.3.2016 from 6:30 p.m onwards at the same place, i.e. High Field, McDonald Hill, Zarkawt.

 

23.3.2017          1) Around 600 (six hundred) members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers' Association (MCHTA) staged a Sit-in demonstration from last night, i.e. 22.3.2017 in demand of regularization of their services/posts at High Field, McDonald Hill, Zarkawt. The agitating members intensified their protest by observing 'Hunger Strike' from this morning. MCHTA sent an appeal letter to all local Churches within Aizawl to to pray for the success of their demand. MCHTA also resolved to give compensation amounting to Rs.30 Lakhs to any member who lost their lives during the course of the agitation. It was reported that as many as 6 (six) agitating members have so far been taken to Civil Hospital, Aizawl for medical treatment. In this connection, MCHTA had also submitted a letter to Director, School Education Department today requesting him to take measures for regularization of their services.

 

                            2) Consequence upon the non-implementation of their demand (i.e. resumption of the construction of Mara Boys Hostel at Zotlang, Aizawl and Mara Girls Hostel at Chawlhhmun, Aizawl), Mara Students' Organisation (MSO) Jt. Headquarters organised indefinite Sit-in demonstration/picketing at Mara House, Aizawl w.e.f. today, i.e. 23.3.2017 @ 9:30 a.m. The agitating members closed the gates and obstructed movement of the people and vehicles to and from Mara House. At 12:00 noon, leaders of MSO Jt. Headquarters, Aizawl held a meeting with Pu Chhuah Bei, Executive Member, MADC and Liaison Officer, Mara House, Zotlang at Mara House. MSO leaders gave demand letter to Pu Chhuah Bei. About 70 (seventy) activists of MSO participated in  the Sit-in demonstration and they will continue their demonstration even tonight unless they  receive positive response from MADC authority.

 

24.3.2017          1) Today, i.e. 24.3.2017 @ 12:20 p.m, around 60 (sixty) activists of MNYF gathered near Assembly House, Treasury Square, Aizawl in support of Private Members’ Resolution moved by Er. Lalrinmawia, i.e. ‘MLPC Act kan hman mek hian kohhran, khawtlang, chhungkua leh mimalah harsatna leh buaina nasa tak min thlen avangin he dan hi titawpin MLTP Act kan hman thin ang kha hman leh ni rawh se (Due to the negative impact on the church, society, family and individual, MLPC Act be replaced by the erstwhile MLTP Act)’ at the Assembly Budget Session today. They chanted slogans and displayed banners and posters in demand for the revocation of MLPC Act. Pu R. Lalhnuna, General Secretary, MNF and
Pu K. Vanlalvena, President, MNYF delivered speeches during the short gathering.

 

                            2) Agitating members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers' Association (MCHTA) are continuing their 'Indefinite Hunger Strike' today, i.e. 24.3.2017. So far, 93 (ninety three) hunger strikers have been brought to Civil Hospital, Aizawl for medical check up and out of which only one pregnant woman (i.e. Pi Zonunmawii, Chamdur Middle School, Lawngtlai District) who suffered a miscarriage was admitted in the Hospital. It may also be mentioned that a Medical Team from Civil Hospital, Aizawl is closely monitoring the health condition of all the hunger strikers. Leaders of MCHTA also sent a letter to Secretary, School Education Department, Government of Mizoram today, i.e. 24.3.2017 requesting him to take measures for regularisation/absorption of their services.

 

27.3.2017          1) Today, i.e. 27.3.2017, around 150 (one hundred fifty) members of Mizoram Merchant Association (MIMA) took out a procession within Aizawl City in protest against opening of Vishal Mega Mart at LRM Building, Bawngkawn, Aizawl. Protesters marched from Millennium Centre at around 11:00 a.m and proceeded towards Bawngkawn via Zarkawt. However, members of MIMA peacefully ended their procession at Chanmari, Aizawl at around 12:30 p.m due to preventive measures taken by Mizoram Police. In a subsequent Press Statement issued today, leaders of MIMA thanked all the public and members of MIMA for their support and also for closing down their shops/business establishments during the procession. MIMA also stated that they ended their procession at Chanmari junction respecting the request made by Bawngkawn Local Council. MIMA also expressed their determination to continue their protest. However, further course of action is yet to be decided.

 

                            2) Around 500 (five hundred) agitating members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers’ Association (MCHTA) continued their indefinite hunger strike for the fifth consecutive day today, i.e. 27.3.2017 in demand of regularization/absorption of their services and disbursement of their six month's salary. So far, 53 (fifty three) protestors were admitted in Civil Hospital, Aizawl and 24 (twenty four) were discharged from the Hospital. Meanwhile, Zarkawt Local Council, after consulting Zarkawt based NGOs had urged the protesters to shift elsewhere citing various sanitation and security issues that the locality could encounter.

 

28.3.2017          Around 700 (seven hundred) agitating members of Mizoram CSS Hindi Teachers' Association (MCHTA) continued their indefinite hunger strike for the sixth consecutive day today, i.e. 28.3.2017. As many as 80 protesters vowed not to drink even a drop of water while observing their hunger strike. They were confined in one location at the top of the building of Teacher's Inn, Aizawl. Meanwhile, Pu P.C. Vanlaldinga, Adviser, MCHTA sent a letter to Chairman/Secretary, Mizoram Kohhran Hruaitu Committee (MKHC) today, i.e. 28.3.2017 in which he sought the intervention of MKHC for resolving the stand-off between Government of Mizoram and agitating members of MCHTA. It was reported that leaders of MKHC, i.e. Mizoram Church Leaders’ Committee is likely to discuss the matter on the morning of 30.3.2017.

 

6.4.2017            Trainees Union of Industrial Training Institute, Lunglei organised picketing against Teachers and staff of ITI, Lunglei today in protest against the transfer of Pu Vanlalhruaia Sailo, Principal, ITI, Lunglei to ITI, Aizawl. About 30 (thirty) agitating trainees performed duties near the gate of ITI, Lunglei today.

 

13.4.2017          Vengsang and Tlangsam Dairy Cooperative Society Ltd., Champhai continued their picketing against officers and staff of District Veterinary Office, Champhai for the sixth consecutive day today, i.e. 13.4.2017. 20 (twenty) agitating members of Vengsang and Tlangsam Dairy Cooperative Society Ltd., Champhai performed picketing today and they intended to continue the picketing next Monday, i.e. 17.4.2017. No untoward incident was reported during the picketing.

 

18.4.2017          Mizo Zirlai Pawl (MZP) Headquarters, Champhai is organizing 'Indefinite Total Bandh' w.e.f. today, i.e. 18.4.2017 @ 6:00 a.m within Champhai town in demand of posting of additional Medical Doctors and Medical Staff at Champhai District Hospital, Champhai. All commercial activities, Government offices and vehicular movement were shut down due to the Total Bandh. As many as 250 (two hundred fifty) activists of MZP performed duties at 15 (fifteen) duty posts within Champhai town.

 

20.4.2017          Mizo Zirlai Pawl (MZP) Headquarters, Champhai commenced their picketing against Government servants, teachers, students and employees of Banks including Private Banks today, i.e. 20.4.2017 within Champhai area. As many as 370 (three hundred seventy) MZP activists performed duties at various Government offices, educational institutions and Banks and they obstructed workers/students from attending offices and schools. As a result of the picketing, all Government offices, educational Institutions including Private Schools and Banks were closed down. MZP activists also bolted the main doors of DC, Champhai office and SP, Champhai office with locks.

 

24.4.2017          The agitation organized by Mizo Zirlai Pawl (MZP) Headquarters, Champhai with the support of NGOs and Political Parties was called off from today, i.e. 24.4.2017. All  Government offices, educational institutions, etc.were opened today.

 

26.4.2017          About 19 (nineteen) agitating members of Vengsang and Tlangsam Dairy Cooperative Societies Ltd., Champhai resumed their picketing duty against the officers and staff of District Veterinary Office, Champhai for the 11th day today, i.e. 26.4.2017 in demand of payment of their undue dairy bills. It was reported that the agitating members of Vengsang and Tlangsam Dairy Cooperative Societies Ltd., Champhai intended to intensify their agitation if their demand is not fulfilled by the Government on or before 30th April, 2017.

 

16.5.2017          Information has been received that the residents and students of Vawngawnzo village, Mamit District had obstructed Pi Lalduhi Royte, Headmistress of Government Vawngawnzo Primary School from joining her new place of posting, i.e. Government New Eden Primary School today, i.e. 16.5.2017.

 

22.5.2017          Members of Mizoram Health Multipurpose Service Association (MHMSA) organized a 'Pendown Strike' from today, i.e. 22.5.2017 in protest against the alleged apathetic attitude of the State Government towards their demand, i.e. Amendment of Recruitment Rules (RR) of MHMSA. The agitating members will hold a meeting on 25.5.2017 @ 1:00 p.m at Chanmari YMA, Aizawl to review and discuss about their ongoing agitation.

 

31.5.2017          Today, i.e. 31.5.2017, National Trade Union of Mizoram (NTUM) commenced their indefinite picketing against staff of Advanced Research Centre for Bamboo and Rattan (ARCBR), Bethlehem Vengthlang, Aizawl in protest against the alleged sacking/termination of 8 (eight) workers by ARCBR w.e.f. tomorrow, i.e. 1.6.2017. The agitating members of NTUM pasted posters on the premises of ARCBR portraying their demands for allocation of budget for outsourced workers, reservation of posts for local people and regularisation of outsourced workers and their protest against deportation of outsourced workers, skill down of workers and regularisation of staff from other states. About 20 (twenty) members of NTUM performed picketing under the leadership of their President, Pu C. Remtluanga.

 

1.6.2017            1) MSU Sub-Headquarters, Mauchar, Aizawl District organised a procession in protest against the alleged physical assault and harassment of students of Government Primary School, Mauchar by Lalhunthara, S/o Thangduailova and Khuangthanmawia, S/o Thanbanglova on 30.5.2017 within the school premises. MSU Sub-Headquarters, Mauchar closed down all Government Schools - Government Primary School, Government Middle School and Government High School w.e.f. today, i.e. 1.6.2017 and they intended to close down Government Schools until authority from the Government of Mizoram conduct necessary verification over the incident.

 

                            2) MZP Headquarters, Kolasib organised picketing against staff of Government Schools and Government offices within Kolasib town, excluding staff of Hospitals and Police personnel today, i.e. 1.6.2017 in protest against non-fullfillment of their demand, i.e. revocation of the transfer order of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng, Surgeon, District Hospital, Kolasib. About 20 (twenty) activists of MZP performed picketing duties and all Government offices including DC Office, offices of SBI and Rural Banks and Government Schools were closed.

 

2.6.2017            MZP Headquarters, Kolasib resumed their picketing against staff of Government Schools and Government Offices within Kolasib town today, i.e. 2.6.2017 in protest against non-fullfillment of their demand, i.e. revocation of the transfer order of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng, Surgeon, District Hospital, Kolasib. MZP Headquarters, Kolasib has intensified their picketing duty  today by including Private Schools. About 50 (fifty) activists of MZP performed duties at various schools and Government offices.

                                           Meanwhile, DC, Kolasib held a meeting with leaders of MZP Headquarters, Kolasib @ 1:20 p.m. However, there was no positive outcome from the Government. The picketing was called off by MZP Headquarters, Kolasib @ 1:35 p.m.

 

6.6.2017            Joint Action Committee (JAC), Kolasib organized indefinite blockade of NH-54 at Khuangpuilam and Rengtekawn, Kolasib w.e.f. today, 6.6.2017 @ 5:00 a.m in continuation of their demand for the revocation of the transfer order of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng, Surgeon, District Hospital, Kolasib. Due to the imposition of strike, all Government Offices, Banks and Educational Institutions within Kolasib town were closed down. As many as 350 (three hundred fifty) activists of JAC, Kolasib performed duties today and consequence upon the blockade, about 108 (one hundred eight) vehicles (92 at Khuangpuilam side and 16 at Rengtekawn side) were stranded along NH-54 while writing this report.

 

8.6.2017            Sakawrhmuituai Group YMA also organized road blockade of Serkhan-Bagha Road at Serkhan today, i.e. 8.6.2017 in support of the agitation being carried out by JAC, Kolasib. However, Sakawrhmuituai Group YMA called off their road blockade @ 4:00 p.m today following instructions received from Sub-Headquarters YMA, Kolasib.

 

9.6.2017            1) Joint Action Committee (JAC), Kolasib continued their indefinite blockade of NH-54 for the fifth consecutive day today, i.e. 9.7.2017 at Diakkawn, Kolasib.

                                           Meanwhile, Pu Lal Thanzara, Hon’ble Minister, H&FW met media persons in his office chamber today, i.e. 9.6.2017 @ 4:30 p.m over the transfer and posting of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng. Pu Lal Thanzara informed media persons that the Government of Mizoram is willing to transfer Dr. Zochampuia in lieu of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng from District Hospital, Kolasib to District Hospital, Serchhip. Accordingly, JAC, Kolasib held a meeting this evening @ 5:30 p.m at Diakkawn YMA Hall, Kolasib and the meeting agreed to accept the offer, i.e. transfer of Dr. Zochampuia in lieu of Dr. Zothansanga Zadeng at District Hospital, Serchhip made by the Hon’ble Health Minister. Subsequently, JAC, Kolasib called off their blockade of NH-54 @ 10:22 p.m after Government of Mizoram issued the transfer and posting order.

 

                            2) Today, i.e. 9.6.2017 @ 12:00 Noon, leaders of National Trade Union of Mizoram (NTUM) held a meeting with Pu M.Z. Singson, Director, ARCBR. During the meeting, the Director reportedly assured leaders of NTUM that he will take initiative for the continuation of service of 8 (eight) Mizo staff at ARCBR. Consequence upon this meeting, NTUM called off their picketing against staff of ARCBR today @ 12:30 p.m. NTUM intended to intensify their agitation if their demand is not fulfilled within one month’s time.

 

21.6.2017          Gorkha Janmukti Morcha, Mizoram State Committee (GJM-MSC) held a peaceful sit-in demonstration today, i.e. 21.6.2017 from 7:00 a.m to 8:00 a.m at Zodin Square, Aizawl in support of Gorkhaland State demand at Darjeeling, West Bengal. Around three hundred (300) Gorkhas in Aizawl participated in the demonstration.

 

3.7.2017            Joint NGO Coordination Committee, Kamalanagar organised indefinite picketing against office staff of Chakma Autonomous District Council (CADC) w.e.f. today, i.e. 3.7.2017 @ 9:00 a.m in demand for the revocation of the recruitment order of 140 (one hundred forty) staff of CADC who were allegedly recruited without any advertisement. As many as 100 (one hundred) activists of Joint NGO Coordination Committee performed duty today and the picketing was called off for today @ 2:35 p.m.

 

5.7.2017            Joint NGO Coordination Committee, Kamalanagar resumed their indefinite picketing against office staff of Chakma Autonomous District Council (CADC) today, i.e. 5.7.2017 @ 9:00 a.m and the picketing was intensified by imposing strike against all Educational Institutions under CADC.

                                           Joint NGO Coordination Committee, Kamalanagar has called off the picketing today @ 12:30 p.m and they are scheduled to give Memorandum to DC, Lawngtlai District demanding removal of the 140 (one hundred forty) staff of CADC who were allegedly  recruited by violating rules, etc. Joint NGO Coordination Committee intended to await the response of DC, Lawngtlai District till 10th July, 2017 and they proposed to organise total bandh w.e.f. 11th July, 2017 if their demand is not fulfilled.

 

10.7.2017          Today, i.e. 10.7.2017 @ 10:30 a.m, MNF District Headquarters, Kamalanagar (Chawngte) organised a sit-in demonstration in front of Session Hall of Chakma Autonomous District Council (CADC) in protest against the order of the Hon’ble Governor of Mizoram on calling a Floor Test of the Executive Committee of CADC headed by Pu Kali Kumar Tongchongya.

                                           During the sit-in demonstration, copies of the Notification of the State Government directing the Chairman of CADC to conduct Special Session and the Session Summon were burnt. Pu Rosik Mohan Chakma, President, MNF District Headquarters, Kamalanagar addressed the gathering in which he appealed the Government of Mizoram to constitute a Commission to enquire upon the allegation of huge corruption in CADC and demanded dissolution of the existing CADC. Pu H. Amresh Chakma, MDC; Pu Lokhi Dan Chakma. Adviser, MNF District Headquarters, Kamalanagar and Pu Duriya Dhan Chakma, General Secretary, MNF District Headquarters, Kamalanagar also addressed the gathering. The sit-in demonstration was called off @ 1:00 p.m after Session of CADC was concluded and about 200 (two hundred) activists took part in the demonstration.

 

11.7.2017          Parents of Government Rosanga Memorial Middle School, Saikhawthlir, Mamit District refrained their children from attending school w.e.f. yesterday, i.e. 10.7.2017 in protest against the alleged habitual absence of 5 (five) teaching staff of the school. They were also agitated over the alleged frequent missing of food/rice for Midday Meal. They demanded the School Headmaster, Pu J. Chawnghmingthanga, who is attached to DEO Office, Mamit to join his post immediately and also demanded the concerned authority to immediately inspect Government Rosanga Memorial Middle School.

 

18.7.2017          Lawngtlai Auto Rickshaw Owners & Drivers Association (LAROA) organised blockade of National Highway-54 at the outskirt of Lawngtlai town today, i.e. 18.7.2017 in protest against the imposition of new parking rules within Bazar Veng, Lawngtlai. LAROA also issued a Memorandum today in which they threatened to intensify their blockade of road w.e.f. 20.7.2017. As many as 60 vehicles were stranded due to the blockade of road.

 

19.7.2017          Today, i.e. 19.7.2017 @ 9:30 a.m, activists of MZP General Headquarters led by their Office Bearers numbering about 75 (seventy five) gathered in front of Technical Wing, Higher & Technical Education Department, Chaltlang, Aizawl to show their protest against inclusion of the following 6 (six) students belonging to Chakma community for Counselling Session for the filling up of seats in MBBS and BDS under Mizoram State quota.

 

20.7.2017          1) Activists of MZP General Headquarters gathered infront of the Office of Jt. Director, H&TE (Technical Wing), Government of Mizoram at Chaltlang, Aizawl today, i.e. 20.7.2017 in protest against the inclusion of students belonging to Chakma community for Counselling Session for filling up of seats in MBBS and BDS under Mizoram State quota. The situation was escalated as the 4 (four) Chakma students entered the office building for Counselling Session under the escort of Mizoram Police despite the protest/objection by the agitating students.

 

                            2) MZP Headquarters, Mamit organised a protest gathering at Mamit town today, i.e. 20.7.2017 in protest against the inclusion of Chakma for Counselling Session for filling up of seats in MBBS and BDS under Mizoram State quota. During the protest function, Pu Lalropuia, President, MZP Headquarters, Mamit delivered a speech in which he extended his support on the initiative taken by MZP General Headquarters on Chakma issue.

 

21.7.2017          MZP Sub-Headquarters, Tlabung organised Total Bandh today, i.e. 21.7.2017 in protest against the inclusion of students belonging to Chakma community for Counselling Session for filling up of seats in MBBS and BDS under Mizoram State quota. The Total Bandh was called off at 12:00 noon.

 

26.7.2017          Relatives and friends of deceased Lalruatfela (18) (inmate of Tawngtai Bethel Camping Centre, Chawnpui, Aizawl) held a peaceful demonstration at the courtyard of Tawngtai Bethel Camping Centre today, i.e. 26.7.2017 @ 11:00 a.m. The demonstration was attended by about 130 (one hundred thirty) persons.

 

28.7.2017          MZP Headquarters, Kolasib and MSU Headquarters, Kolasib jointly organised picketing against non-Mizos within Kolasib town today, i.e. 28.7.2017 in protest against the alleged rape of a juvenile by David Kondo (29), S/o Soin Kondo (L) of Hmarkhawlian, Assam yesterday, i.e. 27.7.2017. They asked non-Mizos to remain at home/indoor during the picketing which is scheduled to last till midnight of 30th July, 2017 (Sunday). Meanwhile, about 1,200 (one thousand two hundred students) of St. John School, Kolasib took out a Silent Procession today, i.e. 28.7.2017 @ 10:30 a.m in protest against the alleged rape of their fellow student.

 

31.7.2017          Saitual District Implementing Demand Committee (SDIDC) took out a procession today, i.e. 31.7.2017 @ 10:00 a.m within Saitual Town area in continuation of their demand for the implementation of Saitual District. The procession was commenced from two different junctions, i.e. Saitual Hmar Veng and Keifang. As many as 3,000 (three thousand) residents of Saitual town had participated at the procession and they assembled at the courtyard of SDO (Civil) Office, Saitual.

 

2.8.2017             As many as 2,000 (two thousand) students under the aegis of Mizo Students' Union (MSU) General Headquarters and Aizawl City Colleges Joint Students' Union (ACCJSU) assembled infront of Vanapa Hall, Aizawl today, i.e. 2.8.2017 @ 10:00 a.m in protest against the summoning of leaders of MSU and ACCJSU by the Court today in connection with Bawngkawn PS Case No. 26/2016 Dt.21.01.2016 u/s 143/145/149/152/353/427 IPC. Pu Samuel Zoramthanpuia, Secretary, MSU presided over the gathering function wherein Pu P.C. Lalrinhlua, ex-President, MSU delivered a speech.

                                                       Consequence upon the application submitted by Public Prosecutor, R.C. Thanga for withdrawal of the case, Pu H. Lalduhsanga, CJM, Aizawl issued an order for the discharge of all the 12 (twelve) accused persons. After the order was issued, Pu R.B. Lalmalsawma, President, MSU addressed the gathering students and the students dispersed peacefully without any untoward incident at about 2:00 p.m.

 

7.8.2017             Today, i.e. 7.8.2017 @ 11:30 a.m, around 1,000 (one thousand) people under the banner of All Chakma NGOs, Kamalangar, Chawngte organised a procession in protest against the alleged denial of MBBS seats to 4 (four) Chakma students under Mizoram State quota. The procession was commenced from Buddhist Temple, Kamalanagar and they marched towards office of SDO(C), Chawngte. Leaders of All Chakma NGOs tried to submit a copy of the Memorandum for the Hon'ble Minister, H&TE, etc. to SDO(C). However, about 30 (thirty) members of MZP General Headquarters led by Pu B. Vanlaltana, Vice President, MZP General Headquarters obstructed them from submitting the Memorandum and there was a slight tussle between activists of MZP and All Chakma NGOs, Kamalanagar. During the tussle, the copy of the Memorandum was reportedly snatched away by activists of MZP. The situation was controlled due to the intervention of SDO(C) Chawngte and Mizoram Police. Members of All Chakma NGOs, Kamalanagar dispersed peacefully at around 12:00 noon.

 

8.8.2017             Today, i.e. 8.8.2017 @ 11:00 a.m, students of B.Tech, Mizoram University took out a procession from Academic Building of Department of B.Tech to Administrative Building, Mizoram University in protest against the dilapidated condition of internal roads within Mizoram University. They submitted a Memorandum to the Registrar, Mizoram University demanding him to take initiative for the immediate repairing of roads. About 65 (sixty five) aggrieved students participated at the procession and the students dispersed peacefully @ 12:30 p.m.

 

14.8.2017           Khawzawl District Implementing Demand Committee (KDIDC) and All NGOs, Khawzawl organised Total Bandh today, i.e. 14.8.2017 from 5:00 a.m to 5:00 p.m within Khawzawl town. All commercial establishments, Educational Institutions within Khawzawl town were closed during the Bandh. However,  around 25 (twenty five) vehicles were stranded along the National Highway connecting Khawzawl town till 4:40 p.m. The Bandh was peacefully called off at 5:00 p.m.

 

17.8.2017           Today, i.e. 17.8.2017, Chakma National Council of India (CNCI), Mizoram State Committee and Chakma NGOs, Kamalanagar, Chawngte organised 'Chakma Black Day' by gathering at Kamalanagar-II (Rexi Square) in condemnation of the Radcliffe Award of Bengal Boundary Commission which awarded Chittagong Hill Tracts unjustly to Pakistan during partition of Indian Sub-Continent in 1947. As many as 200 (two hundred) people participated at the 'Chakma Black Day' and they burnt the copy of the Radcliffe Award of Bengal Boundary Commission.
Shri Rasik Mohan Chakma, President, CNCI, Mizoram; Shri Alak Bikash Chakma, Vice President, CNCI, Mizoram and Shri Amarsmriti Chakma, Vice President, CNCI, Mizoram delivered speeches during the function in which they demanded the intervention of Government of Great Britain in resolving  the crisis of Chakmas in Bangladesh. They also urged the International Chakma community to start observing the Chakma Black Day. The gathering was peacefully called off @ 1:30 p.m.

 

22.8.2017           Today, i.e. 22.8.2017, employees of Public Sector Banks went on a one-day nationwide strike in protest against the Government's proposed consolidation move, besides raising other demands. Around 200 (two hundred) employees of different Banks within Aizawl also staged a demonstration in front of SBI Main Branch.

 

24.8.2017          1) Today, i.e. 24.8.2017, MZP Sub-Headquarters, Tlabung organised picketing against Chakma Students of Government High School, Tlabung in protest against the alleged verbal intimidation of Mizo girl students by Chakma students. In this regard, a Press Release was issued by MZP Sub-Headquarters, Tlabung wherein they demanded the School authority to dispel the responsible Chakma students from the School and they maintained that they will conduct checking of Birth Certificate of Chakma students enrolled in Government High School, Tlabung.

 

                            2) Hortoki Joint Action Committee and Kawnpui Joint Village Councils organised picketing against vehicles of Contractors under North East Frontier Railway today, i.e. 24.8.2017 @ 9:00 a.m at Hortoki junction, Kawnpui. and NEF Railway junction, Hortoki. As many as 200 (two hundred) members performed picketing duties at the two junctions. The picketing was organised in demand for the repairing of road between Hortoki and Kawnpui by North East Frontier Railway. It was learnt that Hortoki Joint Action Committee and Kawnpui Joint Village Councils will wait the response of North East Frontier Railway till 30.9.2017 before taking further course of action.

 

25.8.2017           About 30 activists of MZP General Headquarters led by Pu Lalsangzuala Ngente, President, Pu B. Vanlaltana, Vice President, Pu L. Ramdinliana Renthlei, General Secretary etc, performed picketing duty against Chakma students at the office of Technical Wing, H&TE, Aizawl where Counselling Session for MBBS/BDS was conducted. However, no Chakma students has turned up today and leaders of MZP called off their picketing duty after the Counselling Session was completed.

 

5.9.2017             Around 200 (two hundred) members of Mizoram University Teachers' Association (MIZUTA) observed 'Demand Day' today, i.e. 5.9.2017 within MZU Campus, Tanhril during which they organized 'Sit-in Demonstration' infront of MZU Auditorium and they also marched from MZU Auditorium to MZU Guest House. Members of MIZUTA organized 'Demand Day' in protest against the alleged apathetic attitude of Central Government towards their demand  like implementation of the recommendation of Pay Review Committee headed by V.S. Chauhan, etc. The peaceful protest was organized as per the nationwide protest called by All India Federation of University and College Teachers' Organization (AIFUCTO) and Federation of Central University Teachers' Association.

 

6.9.2017             Mizoram University Students' Council (MZUSC) staged indefinite shutdown of Mizoram University w.e.f. today, i.e. 6.9.2017 @ 8:30 a.m. As many as 500 (five hundred) agitating students gathered infront of Mizoram University Main Entrance Gate and they obstructed all staff of Mizoram University including Prof. Lianzela, Acting Vice Chancellor from entering MZU Campus. At around 10:30 a.m, a small function was held near MZU Main Entrance Gate in which Pu Malsawmsanga,Vice President, MZUSC and Pu Vanlalzuata, General Secretary, MZUSC addressed the students. They stated that MZUSC will continue their strike until Vice Chancellor of MZU is appointed. They also urged all the students and staff of MZU to support the initiative taken by MZUSC and also appealed Mizoram University Students' Discussion Forum to cancel their proposed holding of National Level Workshop on the topic "Youth and Politics in India with special reference to North East India" on 7.9.2017. Leaders of MZUSC also asked all the students of MZU to perform picketing duty tomorrow, i.e. 7.9.2017 at MZU.

                                           During the meeting they chanted a slogan, "We demand a regular Vice Chancellor" and displayed banners/placards which read "Justice for MZU", "University without regular VC is like a Cabinet without Modiji", etc. They also passed a resolution that "All academic as well as non-academic activities be shut down until and unless regular Vice Chancellor is appointed."

 

8.9.2017             MSU General Headquarters and Regional Headquarters, Lunglei and Sub-Headquarters in some District capitals observed today, i.e. 8.9.2017 as 'Zo Hnam Chhan Ni' (Day of Safeguarding Zo Tribe). As a part of the observation, about 10 (ten) MSU activists performed picketing duty within Aizawl City against non-Mizo shops from 6:30 a.m. The picketing duty closed down about 10 (ten) non-Mizo shops today and no untoward incident was reported.

 

11.9.2017           1) Mizoram Truck Owners' Association (MTOA) and Mizoram Truck Drivers' Association (MTDA) imposed a 3 (three) day strike w.e.f. today, i.e. 11.9.2017 in protest against the alleged apathy of the Government to repair dilapidated condition of road (NH) connecting Bairabi to Aizawl. As many as 29 (twenty nine) supply Trucks are reportedly stranded at National Higway-54 near Kolasib due to the strike.

 

                            2) Students' Union of Pachhunga University College (PUC), a Constituent College of MZU organised picketing duty today, i.e. 11.9.2017 at the main entrance of their College in support of the initiative taken by MZUSC for the immediate appointment of regular Vice Chancellor of MZU. They boycotted classes and obstructed Teaching staff and Non-teaching staff from entering the College campus. Meanwhile, other colleges within Aizawl City are functioning smoothly as they did not join the strike (picketing).

 

12.9.2017           The 3 (three) day strike imposed by Mizoram Truck Owners' Association (MTOA) and Mizoram Truck Drivers' Association (MTDA) was continued today, i.e. 12.9.2017 in protest against the alleged apathy of the Government to repair dilapidated condition of road (NH) connecting Bairabi to Aizawl. As many as 73 (seventy three) Trucks are reportedly stranded along NH-54 at Rengtekawn due to the strike as on today @ 6:00 p.m.

 

13.9.2017           The 3 (three) days strike imposed by Mizoram Truck Owners' Association (MTOA) and Mizoram Truck Drivers' Association (MTDA) in protest against the alleged apathy of the Government to repair dilapidated condition of roads in Mizoram was called-off today, i.e. 13.9.2017 @ 3:30 p.m. MTOA and MTDA are likely to hold a Joint Meeting on 15.9.2017 at MTOA Office, Aizawl to discuss future course of action.

 

14.9.2017          MNF General Headquarters organised State-wide Total Bandh today, i.e. 14.9.2017 from 5:00 a.m in protest against dilapidated condition of roads in Mizoram and the alleged laxity of the incumbent Congress Ministry to repair the roads. Total Bandh was organised in Aizawl, District Headquarters, Sub-Divisional Headquarters, Towns and Villages and it was enforced by party workers at MNF General Headquarters, Sub-Headquarters, Blocks and Units.

                                           MNF General Headquarters made 41 (forty one) duty posts within Aizawl City and leaders of MNF General Headquarters watched and monitored the said posts. Consequence upon the Total Bandh, all Government offices, Schools and Colleges within Mizoram were closed down.The Total Bandh was called-off at 3:00 p.m without any untoward incident.

 

15.9.2017          MZUSC also organised peaceful demonstration near Raj Bhawan today, i.e. 15.9.2017 @ 1:15 p.m while Dr. Mahesh Sharma, Hon'ble Union Minister of State (Independent charge) for Culture and Environment, Forest & Climate Change arrived at Raj Bhawan. Agitating members of MZUSC dispersed peacefully without any untoward incident.

 

18.9.2017          Academic activities of Mizoram University were resumed w.e.f. today, i.e. 18.9.2017 as MZUSC has called off their strike. However, the fraternity of MZU (Students, Teaching and Non-teaching staff) wore black badges in continuation of the protest against prolonged delay in appointment of Vice Chancellor of MZU.

 

21.9.2017          Chawngte Area Joint Action Committee, Chawngte organised Total Bandh today, i.e. 21.9.2017 from 6:00 a.m within Chawngte area due to shortage of power supply for the past few days. The Total Bandh was called-off @ 3:20 p.m and no untoward incident was reported during the Total Bandh.

 

22.9.2017          Today, i.e. 22.9.2017 @ 10:00 a.m, Chawngte Area Joint Action Committee, Chawngte (YMA, YCA, MCSU, MZP, CMS, YLA, MSU, MHIP, ZDU, ADU, TARUM and MWA) organised a peaceful procession from Chawngte Bazar to SDO(C) Office, Chawngte in continuation of their protest against shortage of power supply within Chawngte area. As many as 1,500 (one thousand five hundred) agitating people participated at the procession and they submitted a Memorandum for Hon'ble Chief Minister of Mizoram to SDO(C).

 

28.9.2017          1) Lunglei to Aizawl Maxi Cab Service Drivers' Welfare continued their strike by remaining off-road today, i.e. 28.9.2017 for the second consecutive day in protest against the reduction of Maxi Cab fare between Aizawl to Lunglei from Rs. 440/- to Rs. 370/- by State Transport Authority. However, Lunglei to Aizawl Maxi Cab Service Drivers' Welfare intended to resume service/plying w.e.f. tomorrow, i.e. 29.9.2017 at their own existing fare, i.e. Rs. 440/- . 

 

         2) Today, i.e. 28.9.2017 @ 9:00 a.m, MSU Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte organised picketing against Chakma students of Government Kamalanagar College and Government Kamalanagar Higher Secondary School, Chawngte in protest against the alleged disturbance of the Annual School Sports of Government Kamalanagar Higher Secondary School, Chawngte held at Kamalanagar Field on 26.9.2017 by some Chakma youths. About 15 (fifteen) activists of MSU performed picketing duty and there was a tussle between MSU activists and students of Government Kamalanagar College and one MSU leader reportedly sustained minor injury. Consequence upon the picketing, Government Kamalanagar College and Government Kamalanagar Higher Secondary School was closed-down today.

                                           Consequence upon the alleged assault of leaders of MSU Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte by some Chakma students at Chawngte today, 10 (ten) leaders of MSU General Headquarters led by R.B. Lalmalsawma, President and Lalthanzuala, Gen. Secy. entered  Chakma House at Hunthar Veng, Aizawl today, i.e. 28.9.2017 @ 2:30 p.m and damaged 2 (two) Computer Sets, 1 (one) Computer Printer and 1 (one) Steel Almirah. They also threatened all Chakmas lodging at Chakma House excluding sick persons to leave Chakma House before 7:00 p.m (tonight).

 

29.9.2017          1) Today, i.e. 29.9.2017 @ 10:00 a.m, MSU General Headquarters and Aizawl City Colleges Joint Students' Union (ACCJSU) organised procession from Vanapa Hall and they marched towards Chakma House, Hunthar Veng, Aizawl. The procession was organised in protest against the alleged assault of leaders of MSU Sub-Headquarters, Chawngte by some Chakma students at Chawngte yesterday, i.e. 28.9.2017 and as many as 2000 (two thousand) students participated at the procession. Mizoram Police formed a barricade at Vaivakawn-Hunthar junction and they obstructed students from proceeding toward Chakma House. After a successful persuasion and negotiation was made by DC, Aizawl; DIG(NR) and SP, Aizawl, selected leaders of MSU, ACCJSU and media persons numbering about 15 (fifteen) members entered Chakma House under the escort of Mizoram Police. They were contented as they found only 2 (two) sick Chakmas staying at Chakma House. A function was held at Vaivakawn-Hunthar junction in which R.B. Lalmalsawma, President, MSU delivered a speech and they called-off the procession @ 1:35 p.m

 

                            2) Consequence upon the alleged assault of MSU leaders at Chawngte yesterday, i.e. 28.9.2017, MSU Regional Headquarters, Lunglei prohibited Chakma community living in Lunglei from moving out of their house today, i.e. 29.9.2017 from 6:00 a.m to 6:00 p.m. In this regard, about 10 (ten) activists of MSU Regional Headquarters, Lunglei performed duties. No untoward incident is reported due to such imposition of restriction on the movement of Chakmas within Lunglei areas.

                                           MSU Regional Headquarters, Lunglei also issued a Press Release in this regard today wherein they urged the people of Lunglei not to rent out their houses to Chakma community.

 

3.10.2017          Mara Chano Py (MCHP) General Headquarters (Mara Women Association) staged an indefinite picketing against staff of SBI Branch, Siaha w.e.f. today, i.e. 3.10.2017 @ 8:00 a.m in demand for opening of additional SBI Branch within Siaha Town. Around 150 (one hundred fifty) activists of MCHP performed picketing duty and the agitation was supported by Mara Students’ Organisation (MSO) and Mara Thyulia Py (MTP).

 

22.11.2017        Members of Federation of Mizoram Government Employees & Workers (FMGE&W) across the State of Mizoram observed a 2 (two) day Pen-down strike/7th Pay Demand Day from today, i.e. 22.11.2017 in demand  for the implementation of 7th Central Pay Commission Recommendations. Members of FMGE&W (except from emergency services like Police, Hospital, Jail, PHE, etc.) turned up for their respective offices/work places wearing black badges and refused to discharge their duties/perform works.

 

24.11.2017        Joint NGOs of Thuampui (Local Council, YMA, MHIP, MUP, Thuampui Students’ Union and Mizoram Gorkha Youth Association) staged a peaceful demonstration today, i.e. 24.11.2017 @ 10:00 a.m. against the opening of Ace Liquor Shop at Thuampui by Pu Lalfakzuala S/o Dr.Ramfangzauva of Chaltlang, Aizawl. Around 20 (twenty) protestors gathered in front of  Ace Liquor Shop which remained closed today. No untoward incident occurred during the demonstration. It was learnt that Joint NGOsof Thuampui intended to hold a meeting tonight, i.e.24.11.2017 to discuss their future course of action.

 

29.11.2017        Members of Junior Engineers' Service Association of Mizoram (JESAM) availed a 3 (three) day 'Casual Leave' from today, i.e 29.11.2017 in protest against non-implementation of their demand i.e Non-Functional Upgradation. Leaders of JESAM also submitted a letter to Hon'ble Chief Minister of Mizoram today @ 12:30 p.m  in which they expressed their grievances over their service condition and also requested the Hon'ble Chief Minister to take measures for creation of Non-Functional Grade Pay for members of JESAM.

 

6.12.2017          Regular Government employees of Mizoram under the banner of Federation of Mizoram Government Employees & Workers (FMGE&W) commenced availing of 3 Day Mass Casual Leave w.e.f. today, i.e. 6.12.2017 in demand for the implementation of 7th Pay Commission Recommendation. In this regard, FMGE&W made deployments to monitor and ensure that the Mass Casual Leave was observed by members of FMGE&W and about 250 (two hundred fifty) members performed duties.

 

 

 

 

 

2018

 

15.1.2018          Champhai District Border Trade Transport Union (CTU) launched a protest at Mualkawi today, i.e. 15.1.2018 by blocking carrying of all foreign goods via Zokhawthar route. About 16 (sixteen) members of CTU participated in the demonstration. The demonstration was held in protest against transportation of goods beyond Zokhawthar by Zokhawthar to Champhai Transport and Workers' Union (ZCT&WU). No vehicles were stranded due to the blockade while writing this report.

 

25.1.2018          Information has been received that last night, i.e. 24.1.2018 @ 7 p.m. around 30 (thirty) Youths of Sihphir Village gathered at the streets of  Sihphir in protest against Press statement made by MPCC Media Cell which reportedly stated that the Hon’ble Chief Minister's  Security Guards have not assaulted Pu Lalbiakzuala of Sihphir Village. No untoward incident was reported.

                                           In this regard, meeting of Executive Committee of YMA Branch, Sihphir was held today, i.e. 25.1.2018 @ 7:00 p.m. at YMA Conference Hall, Sihphir.
